These two miRNAs participate in the differentiation of mouse embryonic cells [ 74] and hepatocellular carcinoma [ 75]. Our results show that their potential role in the CCDN1/CDK4 complex as an essential oncogenic driver in various cancer types, including melanoma [ 76].
